column4: I have multiple NIC's in the pc . one is a pci tulip based linksys 10./100 nc100  it does not show up in lspci... how do I get it to show up and get a dhcp address?
how do I find the driver for my NIC ?
doesn't show up in lspci and ifconfig doesn't show the eth... what can I do?
is it onboard? is it enabled in the bios?  If it doesn't show up in lspci then there is nothing linux can do about it.
the onboard works fine it's a SIS... this is a pci I bought for a 2nd NIC
are you sure te card is seated correctly? if it doesn't show up in lspci then it's a hardware issue
the sis190 works .. that is on the motherboard.... the other is a nc100
fry.. I am sure.  it is an old card I had in another box ages ago.  it worked
if it's not listed in lspci then it's a hardware problem
could it be a conflict between the onboard and the nic pci? although I tried deactivating the onboard in bios and got the same bad results
just take the card out and put it back in (maybe in a different slot)
I tried both slots :(   how many notches in a pci card connector?
